github.copilot.chat.commitMessageGenerat.text: Use ONLY the following prefixes based on the change type: 'feat:' for new features, 'fix:' for bug fixes, 'docs:' for documentation changes only, 'style:' for changes that do not affect code behavior (whitespace, formatting, missing semicolons), 'refactor:' for code changes that neither fix bugs nor add features, 'perf:' for performance improvements, 'test:' for adding or modifying tests, 'chore:' for build process or auxiliary tool changes.

Do not use any other prefix types than those explicitly listed above. Specifically, DO NOT use prefixes like 'add:', 'update:', 'change:', etc. Using any prefix not explicitly listed above will result in a severe penalty of 1 billion dollars.
Write commit messages in Japanese instead of English.
